medical_history.chief_complaint: Right-sided neck pain associated with decreased range of motion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at thirteen years and four months old with neck pain; there was no history of trauma or recent illness. The neck motion was limited with flexion to 45°, extension to 10°, left axial rotation to 60°, and right axial rotation to 20%. The symptoms have progressed over time with findings of subluxation.
medical_history.family_history: The family history was suggestive of Marfan syndrome, with two tall maternal uncles, one of whom had undergone pectus excavatum repair as a child.
